Detailed Description

This class is the implementation of CKey used for dictionaries and lexicons.

CSwordLDKey is the implementation of CKey for Lexicons and dictionaries. It provides a simple interface to set the current key, to get the text for the key and functions to get the next and previous items of the used module in comparision to the current key.
Here's an example how to use this class:

        CSwordLexiconModuleInfo* m_module = new CSwordLexiconModuleInfo( sword_module );
        CSwordLDKey* ldKey = new CSwordLDKey(m_module);
        ldKey->getPreviousEntry( ldKey );
        qDebug( QString("The current key is: %1").arg(QString::fromLocal8Bit((const char*)*ldKey)));

Please not, that the result will be invalid if use the operator const char* on the adress of the object, use something like this 

        CSwordLDKey* key = new CSwordLDKey( lexicon_module );
        const char* keyname = (const char*)*key;

bool CSwordLDKey::setKey ( const QString ) [virtual]

Sets the key for this key object.

The variable m_data will be cleared. Use getData()() to fill the m_data variable again.
